DOC.HEAD: Nicaraguan Diplomat Slain in Guatemala
DOC.TEXT: A Nicaraguan diplomat was intercepted by gunmen on a street and shot to death Thursday, authorities said. The victim was identified as Jorge Adolfo Vargas, a second secretary at the Nicaraguan Embassy, said a fire department officer who insisted on anonymity. Vargas, 38, was intercepted by the gunmen as he was walking to the embassy in the southeastern part of the capital, shot him and fled, the officer said. The fire department was told of the shooting by an anonymous telephone caller. No one claimed responsibility for the killing. By the time a fire brigade arrived on the scene, Vargas was already dead, the officer said. The body was taken to the city morgue, where he was identified. An employee at the Nicaraguan Embassy, who answered the telephone but refused to give his name, confirmed that Vargas had been assassinated. He said he had no further information. Leftist guerrillas have been active in Guatemala for more than four decades, as have secret rightist death squads who have been hunting down suspected rebels.
